resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

raulcd commented on PR #14634:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14634#issuecomment-1313695948

   @kou I am not entirely sure about the commit afcbbdd9784e0797b567d3572c1da5605b30ab60 to fix the following issue I was able to replicate locally:
   ```
   $ PYTHON=3.10 docker-compose build --no-cache --progress plain python-wheel-manylinux-2014
   ```
   Was failing with the following:
   ```
   #19 418.8 Building upb[codegen,core]:x64-linux...
   #19 418.8
   ```

   ursa-i9-9960x: Supported benchmark langs: Python, R, JavaScript
   ursa-thinkcentre-m75q: Supported benchmark langs: C++, Java

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Since pyarrow seems to have no disposition on this bug already, I am curious if the implementation of openssl included with pyarrow is vulnerable to [https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-3786]

Here is the commit of openssl that this is fixed in:

https://github.com/openssl/openssl/commit/c42165b5706e42f67ef8ef4c351a9a4c5d21639a

comments.body: Hi [~chaig] thanks for bringing awareness around this topic. We have merged a PR that will be released as part of 10.0.1 that updates the bundled version of openssl that gets included on pyarrow wheels to 3.0.7.
